basic_info.headline: SWE Intern @ Esri | Computer Engineering @ UIUC | James Scholar
basic_info.about:
A senior at UIUC studying Computer Engineering with a Statistics minor. I'm passionate about using AI and Machine Learning to solve real-world problems and push the boundaries of what technology can do. I thrive on tackling challenges, learning continuously, and building impactful solutions. Each day is an opportunity to learn, spark new ideas, and be part of the technological progress defining our generation.
Currently open to internship and research opportunities. Let’s connect!

experience.title: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
description:
- Analyzed performance of various LLMs in classifying accelerometer signals for motion tracking in Multiple Sclerosis patients, benchmarking against traditional machine learning models.
- Used Python libraries such as Pandas and NumPy to clean, filter, and batch raw accelerometer data, transforming it into graph-based or structured numeric formats for LLM input.
- Applied and compared prompt engineering techniques (few-shot, zero-shot, numeric, graphical, hybrid) to optimize classification accuracy without fine-tuning.

- Conducted in-depth primary and secondary research to analyze market trends, emerging technologies, and competitive positioning across multiple industries for partner companies. 
- Delivered actionable, data-driven insights that informed product development and long-term growth strategies, supporting executive decision-making through structured analysis and cross-functional collaboration.

experience.title: Software Engineer
description:
- Automated metadata extraction and document tagging workflows using spaCy and custom rules to process unstructured geospatial records. 
- Engineered a context-aware chunking strategy, storing the embeddings in a vector database for scalable semantic search. 
- Designed an efficient retrieval function to surface high-relevance content to the LLM, reducing context length by 15% and improving response precision.
- Combined data preprocessing, semantic retrieval, and prompt engineering to build a complete LLM workflow, enabling a RAG-based chat interface that delivers accurate, context-aware responses to user queries.

experience.title: Summer Intern
description: - Interned with a focus on database management, working on mini projects in SQL and C that deepened my understanding of data systems and their role in product development.

experience.title: Research Intern
description:
- Collaborated with the Mechatronics department to study robotic systems and design components using CAD.
- Drafted a mini research paper, gaining hands-on experience with the key stages of academic research and idea development.

Dean's List

Completed my High School at Gems Modern Academy with a score of 41/45. Securing the IBDP Diploma after switching to the IBDP after completing the first 10 years of my education in the Indian Curriculum and achieving a score of 97.6% in Year 10.

projects.title: LinkedIn Profile Bot
description: I developed and deployed an automated pipeline using Langchain agents and the Proxycurl API to streamline the retrieval and summarization of LinkedIn profile data. The pipeline dynamically extracts data via the Proxycurl API, followed by custom Python modules that preprocess and clean the data, extracting key details such as work experience, skills, and achievements. An LLM is integrated to generate detailed, recruiter-friendly summaries from the processed data. The solution is deployed using Streamlit, providing a user-friendly interface with seamless API integration for on-demand profile analysis, making it ideal for recruitment and talent acquisition professionals.

projects.title: FPGA - Retro Golf Game
description: I Designed and developed a fully playable mini-golf game on FPGA, utilizing System Verilog to integrate custom hardware control and game logic. Real-time user input was implemented via a USB keyboard, with responsive controls for direction and power. The Image-to-COE tool was utilized to store game graphics in BRAM, focusing on efficient memory usage. FSM and a grid based approach was used to achieve dynamic physics gameplay mechanics, including interactions with terrain traps like sand and water. The game was displayed on a 640x480 resolution screen via VGA to HDMI output, ensuring smooth, high-quality visuals on modern displays.

recommendations.recommender_title: Principal AI Product Engineer at Esri
recommendations.content:
In short:
Jay is entirely ready to architect his own intelligent systems.
Jay is a great person to work with.  He cares about his projects, pursues understanding when the experiment does not work as expected, and has really great presentation skills.
Summary:
Jay, was brought in as an intern to work on our teams AI projects.  AI is a broad topic, so we left most of the spaces blank on what he was to accomplish. Jay's previous code projects had a sophistication that was on/above par with his peers. With people like Jay, I find that leaving the details blank gives their professional muse what they need to go beyond! Truely, Jay exceeded what I thought possible in the short timespan he was given.
The details and accomplishments:
Industry wide, there is a large desire from companies and users to use language models to improve the user experience. Esri, sees our role as a company to empower users to do meaningful, impactful work with GIS. We know that our software is a means to important an...
